item.title: Safe and Timely Interstate Placement of Foster Children Act of 2006

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.text: Became Public Law No: 109-239.
Became Public Law No: 109-239.
Signed by President.
Signed by President.
Presented to President.
Presented to President.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S6463)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S6463)
Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 463.
Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.
Received in the Senate.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H3149-3150)
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.(text: CR H3149-3150)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5403.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H3149-3154)
Mr. Herger moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Introduced in House
Introduced in House

item.title: H.R. 5403, Safe and Timely Interstate Placement of Foster Children Act of 2006
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as introduced on May 17, 2006

item.title: H.R. 5403, Safe and Timely Interstate Placement of Foster Children Act of 2006
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as introduced on May 17, 2006

summary.text:
Safe and Timely Interstate Placement of Foster Children Act of 2006 - Amends the Social Security Act to require each state plan for foster care and adoption assistance to provide that the state shall: (1) have in effect procedures for orderly and timely interstate placement of children; (2) complete home studies requested by another state within a specified period; (3) accept such studies received from another state; and (4) not impose any restrictions on contracting with a private agency to conduct such a study.

Directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to make grants for timely interstate home study incentive payments to states that have approved plans and that have completed, and provided the Secretary a report on, such studies.

Expresses the sense of Congress that state agencies should cooperate with courts which have authority with respect to the placement of a child in foster care or for adoption for the purpose of locating a parent of the child.

Amends the definition of "case review system" to: (1) increase the required frequency of state caseworker visits to a child who is placed in foster care outside the state in which the child's parents reside; (2) require a child's health and education record to be supplied to the child at no cost when he/she leaves foster care by reason of having attained the age of majority under state law; and (3) provide for a foster parent's right (currently, opportunity) to be heard in any proceeding (currently, review or hearing) respecting their foster child. Requires state courts to ensure that foster parents, pre-adoptive parents, and relative caregivers of a child in foster care are notified of any such proceedings.

Includes among the purposes of grants to the highest state courts the assessment of the court's role in carrying out state laws requiring proceedings that determine the best strategy to use to expedite the interstate placement of children.

Provides for consideration of out-of-state placements in permanency hearings, case plans, and case reviews.

Requires each plan for child welfare services to include the assurance that the state will eliminate legal barriers to facilitate timely adoptive or permanent placements for children.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

bill.title: Safe and Timely Interstate Placement of Foster Children Act of 2006

item.title: Safe and Timely Interstate Placement of Foster Children Act of 2006
To improve protections for children and to hold States accountable for the safe and timely placement of children across State lines, and for other purposes.
Safe and Timely Interstate Placement of Foster Children Act of 2006
Safe and Timely Interstate Placement of Foster Children Act of 2006
Safe and Timely Interstate Placement of Foster Children Act of 2006
Safe and Timely Interstate Placement of Foster Children Act of 2006

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
